title: Treating Coral Cuts and Wounds
brief: Proper treatment of coral cuts to prevent infection and complications.
steps: Step 1: Clean all coral cuts thoroughly with clean water to remove coral particles.
Step 2: Flush the wound repeatedly to ensure all debris is removed.
Step 3: Apply antiseptic other than iodine to disinfect the wound.
Step 4: Cover with clean bandage and monitor for signs of infection.
Step 5: Change dressing regularly and keep wound clean and dry.
warnings: Never use iodine on coral cuts - some coral polyps feed on iodine and may grow inside your flesh.
Coral cuts are highly prone to infection - thorough cleaning is essential.
Both dead and living coral can cause serious cuts and puncture wounds.
